website_summaries.verdict: Large keys and a nice sized, easy-to-read screen make this unit a good purchase for those with poor eyesight or who struggle to read small type.
pros: Word database is adequate, and the 500,000 word thesaurus and spell-check feature are nice additions
Includes a "confusables" feature that helps users distinguish between words that sound similar and are often confused
However, it is the large viewing screen and letter buttons that set this model apart, making both typing and reading easier on this model than most others
cons: The spell-check feature requires a word to be fairly close to correct in order to recognize the right spelling

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: This did not work. I tried three different sets of new batteries, but the screen only showed partial letters. I was unable to return the item during the time allowed. I did call Amazon later. They were (and still will do so) willing to send me a return label and refund my $107.99, but I can no longer locate it. I believe I threw it away not realizing I paid that much money for such a piece of junk. I have one of the original versions, and it still works. I KNOW I didn't pay much for it.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: A great help to my children
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my children as an reading and writing aid. While my children are reading/writing they can look up words without having to stop and go pick up the unabridged dictionary. Because it is handy my kids are more likely to look up a word rather than guess its meaning
customer_reviews.author: Shoe  Lover!

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this speller. I wish it had an "ENTER" button like my or X-word.
customer_reviews.author: Roland A. St Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I can not do my work with out Franklin spelling , I use to have one for long time until I lost it , so I have to have one.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Monadi

customer_reviews.title: Funny you should communicate
customer_reviews.text: Funny you should communicate. The Franklin Spelling Ace is NOT user friendly, it locks up and I can't get anything from it. I had the little one for many years and it was wonderful but, it wore out. I thought I would get "wonderful" times two or more. No such luck! Bea
customer_reviews.author: B. M. D. from Calif.

customer_reviews.title: It has larger keys & so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It has larger keys & so easy to use. Also can get the meaning of words. Couldn't find this in any local stores.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I think the product is over priced as it does very little more than our old one.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lau

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am a special education teacher. I bought this to aid my students with their spelling. It is not that easy to use. It doesn't recognized a lot of misspelled words. Maybe the more advanced higher priced model would have been a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: Patti from Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Ace of a Speller
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and my husband enjoys using it.
customer_reviews.author: Marylee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: At last a screen with LARGE letters, I would buy this one again,
customer_reviews.author: Judith S.

customer_reviews.title: Thesaurus
customer_reviews.text: Well, I bought two of them. One of them is great and we use it all the time. The other one didn't work so I returned it. This is the third one we have gone through. We use it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Florence

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pleased I found one. It works just fine and I can continue to write novels with its help
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane Kruty

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I do not care for the way the letters are configured and it does not contain some of the features of my old version, such as various forms of the word. I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: louis E. Bellande

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to use for my English final and it was easy to use. I bought mine used and it was in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: @moneymike760

customer_reviews.title: hasn't been useful
customer_reviews.text: My child never figured out how to use this... hasn't been useful
customer_reviews.author: Bay Area Mom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the Franklin Ace! I would recommend it for anyone who struggles with spelling!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: gave it to my sister and she loves it. helps her with her crosswords puzzle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: More modern then the one I had in the 90's. Helped with spelling!
customer_reviews.author: summerlayla

customer_reviews.title: Good Spellimg Ace
customer_reviews.text: This was a refurbished one. They were selling a bunch of these for $10. I like it and it is easy to use. My old one was a Seiko Instruments and was not user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: beware!
customer_reviews.text: be sure to read the other reviews, and understand that return shipping is NOT free!!!
customer_reviews.author: tg

customer_reviews.text: Did not care for this product. Limited vocabulary and not user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: edward maiorine

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: Got this because of the Barton tutoring system. It works fine, but I strongly prefer a computer. You have to be really close for it to get the word.
customer_reviews.author: school mom

customer_reviews.title: Franklin Spelling Ace with Thesaurus
customer_reviews.text: Nice, compact spelling aid for both student and adults alike. Especially useful in both the school and working environment when you need to check the spelling of a particular word or look for another way to say a certain word.
customer_reviews.author: D. Blackman

customer_reviews.title: Fun and convienant
customer_reviews.text: Why is there such a big difference in the prices of these? Why does this one, which is an old model, cost so much? I have this model SA-206S. It was given to me years ago. I use it for spelling, word definition, and to play hangman. :) I've never had a problem with it. It has a very large clear display which is great for me. The only problem is there is no way to download new information or updates. What you buy is what you will have forever; like an old TV set. It's a wonderful little gadget to have. I wouldn't give it up for anything but I wouldn't pay $100+ for it.
customer_reviews.author: Zebracorn

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband to use at work. He loves it! Best of all, my husband spells phoneticly and this speller finds the word he needs. He now carries his speller with him at all times. Another great feature is the keyboard and readout are large enough for him to see without his glasses. I would recommend this speller to anyone who could use a great speller.
customer_reviews.author: Cxanthlvr

customer_reviews.title: spelling ace
customer_reviews.text: I call it my "cheat machine" - extremely helpful for word puzzle games. I actually sen this my granddaughter since I already had one
customer_reviews.author: Maryt

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This spell checker worked great if you have to hand write reports and don't want to carry a huge dictionary with you. This can easily fit in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. One complaint ... the hinges are so small/tiny that the cover falls off. Now the dumb thing won't even turn on!!! Not such a nice product anymore.
customer_reviews.author: SkyTop

customer_reviews.title: The head of the screw that holds the battery is ...
customer_reviews.text: The head of the screw that holds the battery is striped and I can not open it so I can not use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My review
customer_reviews.text: I already had one which I dropped and now it's not working properly so I ordered a reworked one. It was super in the beginning and then stopped working so I returned it and am getting a refund. I'm considering either trying another rework or getting a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Burke

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son and I had to learn how to use it before even giving it to him. I thought it would be different thing but it a nice piece and helps if they know how to at least spell some of the word. I use it more than he does too. But its like a pocket dictionary with alot of things extra.
customer_reviews.author: C. Skiffington

customer_reviews.title: Great Service ...
customer_reviews.text: ....It was shipped on time and was a described ...works perfectly ...
customer_reviews.author: William P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resource at a reasonable priceI
customer_reviews.text: I volunteer in a literacy program for adults, and this was recommended. My student can use it easily. The price was very good, and the item arrived in excellent condition, and in a reasonable time.
customer_reviews.author: leathaj

customer_reviews.title: Franklin Spell Ace
customer_reviews.text: Lost my previous speller and the factory reconditioned Franklin Spelling Ace with Thesaurus is working perfectly. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: xyzperson

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: A reconditioned unit you can't tell from new. Works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Deloma Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: SHE LOVES THIS ITEM AND CAN'T BE WITHOUT IT, ALWAYS AT HER DESK
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Stephen A. Epley

customer_reviews.title: If you are spelling challenged you will enjoy this product !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 85 year old parent who is not that good with modern electronics and he has had no trouble learning to use the Spelling Ace. The keys are wide enough apart so one does not accidently hit 2 keys at one time and the screen display is large enough to see easily. All in all I am very pleased !
customer_reviews.author: L. Pallas

customer_reviews.title: Too Much
customer_reviews.text: Tries to provide too much information and is sometimes difficult to obtain, for example, synonyms of certain words.
customer_reviews.author: H. F. Nawrocki

customer_reviews.title: Large Display , Helpful  Product .
customer_reviews.text: Easy To Use , Good Price, Large Display, Very Helpful,Thanks Again.
customer_reviews.author: Magdy A. Tawadros

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: disappointing - does not include many "crossword" words or many words found in my dictionary on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: J. A.

customer_reviews.title: franklin spelling ace with thesaurus
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work. I returned it. Was it added to my account? How do I see what amount is left ?
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Reed

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was what they said it was. It arrived on time. What else could I want. Tucson AZ USA
customer_reviews.author: USMC 1959-1963

product_meta.title: Franklin SA-206S Spelling Ace with Thesaurus
product_meta.description: Spelling Ace with Thesaurus, 110K owrds, 500k synonyms
feature_bullets: Offers phonetic spell correction for more than 110,000 words
Helps expand users vocabulary with more than 500,000 synonyms and antonyms
Lets people distinguish homophones like "hear" and "here" with Confusables feature
Includes a fun fill in the blank crossword puzzle solver

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars74 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
